n5EnKjYWIUbu2L9Zf9Itdg.text: Went here and had a black and blew burger and a blue moon beer. Man this food was good, will definatly be coming back. I highly reccomend trying this place,you wont be let down.

xu0YxciRygcimG-ifdzzOQ.text: We had lunch here on a Saturday afternoon.  The hostess seemed more bothered than anything when we were seated. The waitress was not knowledgeable about the handful of Gluten Free items on the menu. In fact I had to tell her that something was actually GF even though it was marked on the menu. I ordered the GF chicken tenders which were slightly warm. The water had a funny taste to it so I ordered a coffee with cream and sugar. She brought cream and equal and no spoon to stir my coffee.  I ended up asking the bartender for sugar which they had to go find because there was none behind the bar.   Very disappointed with the food and service.

T0zQy-t33QS_lNlRSccpXw.text: First time to Charlotte,  this place was recommended.  Very nice and clean inside,  Great service.  Had the Dublin broil with asparagus,  off the hook. I would come again.

kH3y2gM2syUWiZQC0MbJ2A.text: Plenty of seating and large bar area too. Only had a few beers but the place had a good vibe to it.

sbPYRewqak_dFAHGczFxow.text: Great experience tonight!!! food was delicious, our waitress was great! Kyle is awesome, he always checks in on his tables, and makes sure everyone is ok!

k66X61NvlMHShvKGN6NJHQ.text: The service was great went for a late dinner ... it was warm so we say outside... I got the Dublin Broil... that I would give 5 stars to! My boyfriend got the the Shepard's pie... was good but not as good as mine. The beer was good my loppyrita was not that great had the guiness shot my boyfriend loved it... EkHZ0-HENqcyLtlHyHPoow.text: Very disappointed in the food. I ordered the Reuben and it was terrible. The meat was like jerky, the cheese was barely melted and the rye bread seemed very lightly toasted. I didn't even give them a second chance at it. It's an Irish Pub. If you can't make a decent Reuben why have food at all. I had to eat something though so I went for fried mozzarella. That was awful as well.   The waitress, Lauren, was extremely nice and very apologetic about the Reuben. Her service was excellent.  On another note...  I was in town for a concert. My friend called in the early afternoon to see if they had anything going on there pre concert and they said no. Turns out the local radio station was having an event there for the concert.   I also received an email today that this establishment also failed to check me in through my OpenTable reservation.  HORRIBLE!!!

5oj25sdTrbE_xHchmu6Cgw.text: I have been there several times for Steelers games and have always had a very good experience with the food and staff.  My only complaint is the high price for drinks, especially on a Sunday.

_g4of3dDQ5vaMSdkwUSedw.text: The only thing Irish about Fitzgerald's is their name and the fact that they serve Guinness.  Other than that, you can expect average food, average drink prices and mediocre service.  They have lots of TVs if you are there to watch a game.  The two times I've been here, there has been no waiting to get in.  Gee, wonder why?  Charlotte has too many options to settle for a "meh" experience.

dhJ0HnIIy_LlQMhV1Zq0iQ.text: Fun, lively atmosphere for a Saturday night.  We started out here for a girlfriends birthday and although we had slow service (they were busy), our server was attentive and the manager (James-you rock!) treated our party to a round of shots!  I didn't sample their food bites, but my friends had the chicken tenders and spinach dip and both looked awesome.  Definitely a cool place to hit while uptown when I just want to hang out and not get dressed up in heels and fancy-wear :)

7wpzOTO64itSw5Nzas9LTA.text: Nothing to write home about, but acceptable bar food with enough variety to satisfy a diverse group.

K17ZChWga1nI1-Rhu0IpTw.text: I haven't been back, nor will I ever go back to Fitzgeralds.  Their New Years Eve event was the worst that I've ever attended.  I've been trying to get a refund of my ticket price because I didn't get even close to my money's worth due to a dangerously over capacity crowd, a glassware shortage, slow bartenders, and a "breakfast buffet" that never materialized.  I've been trying to resolve this issue with the manager, Mike Palmer, and all he did was offer me a coupon to return and "give Fitzgeralds another try".  The problem is that I don't want to go back and eat/drink in an establishment like Fitzgeralds.  I would simply like either the manager or the owner to call me, which I've requested at least a half dozen times since the event, but I still haven't heard from anyone.  Even if there is no refund, I would still like them to answer simple questions like why were the bartenders overserving patrons that night (I routinely saw single customers order 4 or more drinks at a time), how many tickets were sold vs. the max capacity of the venue, and what officials witnessed the crowd that night and deemed it safe to continue selling tickets or letting patrons enter the building.  Very dissapointing customer service, very irresponsible way to run a bar/restaurant.  Very upset customers.

MoJ_ox7GAAbZzGdzLUL69Q.text: Atmosphere was nice. Wait staff was excellent. Food was mediocre. Chicken sliders were not impressive and overcooked. Pretzel bites were over done. At $6-$7 per beer it was overpriced. Pretty big place but nothing Irish. It's just the name.

joMl-isyteDy4g4epttwuQ.text: Too bad the Steelers aren't in the playoffs because this place feels like Pittsburgh on football Sunday!  The football crowd is loud and fun, with a Steelers-friendly DJ to entertain during commercials.  They offer a great appetizer sampler (not your standard frozen food type) and a nice beer selection.  The bar is spacious yet cozy.  This is also a Penn State friendly bar...so if you dig the Steelers and Nittany Lions like we do, check this place out on gameday.  You'll be among friends!!  And...they carry Gentleman Jack : )

jRwSVve0gBOAsULyfS--JQ.text: I was most pleasantly surprised.  I'm glad i did not pay too much attention to the mediocre star rating and occasionally bad review.  The service was excellent and the food was outstanding.  I am planning to eat there again when I am in uptown.  I would recommend it to others.

UR3fzmFE9lkneFECcDayUA.text: I went with my girls a few Saturdays back, we were celebrating a birthday party with my sorority sisters, and all I can say is WOW!! I have yet to be in a less pretentious bar/club/restaurant in Charlotte. Our drinks were served up by great bartenders, the people were fun and not rowdy, and best of all, we weren't molested by weird dudes all night wanting to grind up on us. Secondly, we were treated like queens by the the regular Saturday night DJ that night as well. He took our requests, had shots with us and treated us like we were regulars. Most DJs in the city won't give you the time of day, but Botz was great, he really made our night. We have been back on Saturday night ever since and have had the same great experience. Go here, you won't be disappointed. One more thing, this is an Irish bar in name only, but still a great time.

7rZgxBP37LnZ5MSo0VUZVA.text: Food was disappointing. Shepard's pie was soupy and mushy. Only went here because I had a coupon for $25 off. Well, at least I know where not to go next time

7Rr8jQ9PheBf5U6vzNvNFA.text: Rude staff for making a big deal about sitting at a table in an unused section away from the noisy standing room only crowd, menu was small and only had a few generic appetizers, put reserved on all tables around us even though they obviously weren't so we definitely won't be back

gimgBNl3gnxpkUe_tmNwpQ.text: Came to Charlotte for Valentine's wknd and came across this bar. The 1st time I attended(friday) my friend and I had a great time. Drinks made by a female bartender was good and the energy in the bar was fun. The next nite(sat) b/c we enjoyed ourselves the nite before, we invited another friend to experience this bar. Well this nite was horrible, a bartender by the name of Justin was so RUDE and COCKY all b/c I asked him for a lil bit more liquor b/c the drink was SUPER weak. I asked him very politely and he told me(paying customer), "the drink wasnt weak b/c he made it". My friend and I were in shock how bold he was.  Unless he tasted my drink, how could he tell me how it tasted? He refused to add more liquor, but he did add some nasty behavior along wit his sidekick wit reddish hair. They proceeded to embarrass me, the one w/ the reddish hair LIED and told a bouncer that I said things that I didnt say. A supposedly mgr on shift definitely wasnt any help and didnt care to provide humble customer service. So basically they called a bouncer to have me removed fr the bar all because Justin's ego was shot. Before I left, the so called mgr(didnt get his name) added a bit more liquor after I asked numerous times for a refund for the drink I didnt drink. Because I didnt want to escalate the situation into a physical altercation, I left the drink and the bar feeling disrespected, embarrassed, pissed,etc. I refused to allow how I got treated untold. So this is my first time EVER writing a review because I felt the treatment was so unnecessary. Justin must think thats he's the best bartender in the world and cant make a weak drink..so he lashes out like a spoiled brat b/c his drink wasnt satisfying. But to put the icing on the cake, I saw a couple days later that they had the audacity to still CHARGE my card and a full cup of weakness was left on the bar. But please believe they will refund my money b/c Im not gonna get treated like this by these barbaric men.  SHAME..SHAME..SHAME

azo3tWC7rpMBfAklqCUjcQ.text: Great atmosphere at Fitzgerald's, seems clean and the service has been good each time I've been there. However if you are looking for an Irish bar, go to Ri Ra's, it can't be beat.  That being said, Fitzgerald's is a great spot for nightlife that is away from the Epicenter.

jgT4e3aYyR1mV64yOdMS0A.text: A good place to dance. The wife and I go there for that and some shots once in a while.   Went there with friends last month during the Rich & Bennett Pub Crawl too. Had a good time. Not sure what their food taste like so I'll probably update this once I try them. Nothing fancy or bad about it from our experience.  The DJ kills it with some latest and some NINETIES shiz. Makes us folks who crossed over to the third decade go crazy.

c5vCycwPr0zDjUytSCmTZw.text: Tonight I went into a bar near my hotel and the table sitting next to me was so intensely rude I could not even enjoy my dinner. There was a table of Tennessee fans that were so upset they lost their game that they profusely badgered at the workers for reasons that were entirely irrelevant. They were so intoxicated it was embarrassing. The waitress kept a smile on her face and was as polite to them as she was to us. We came in for cold beer, good food and a smile on their face to finish off our weekend in town. Approximately half way through their meal, just as we were having our food delivered, they asked for their checks. As we were eating I couldn't resist the urge to eaves drop on the conversation going on next to us. Like many restaurants, there is a policy instilled on larger parties where the restaurant is allowed to apply a service fee to ensure that their server is given an appropriate tip for their service to the customers, which was applied to our larger party as well. Once receiving their bills I heard them complaining about the attached fee. The manager was called over as soon as the waitress was aware of the situation at hand. The manager informed them of the policy and once again the table was nothing but disrespectful and the least bit understandable to the point where they began raising their voices and causing a bit of a scene. The manager was very polite and I was baffled by the way she was able to maintain her composure throughout the entirety of her conversation with the disgruntled customer. I, myself, was beyond impressed with the amount of professionalism portrayed by the employees within the establishment throughout the conversations that took place and my loss of words for the blatant disrespect of the fellow customers. I will definitely be returning to the bar for a delicious Juicy J and buffalo chicken dip! Thank you for finishing off a great weekend with my friends and family.

AbGcclJCBc6qJJvUdS-lnQ.text: Got stuck due to a delayed flight and came in for lunch on a Tuesday at noon. Special was a chicken sandwich. Good food. Had a couple pints of Guinness, good, poured properly, attentive bar tender. The bar area is nice and clean. Comfortable seats, lots of tvs. They have this mobile charging station on one of the pillars by the bar where you can put your phone and lock it in the drawer to charge safely while you continue about you business. I think that is a nice convenience and a good idea. Seems like they have some decent drink and food specials. Lots of space.   I like it.  Also, they have a decent selection of Irish whiskey. But I would consider it a sports bar with an Irish feel rather than an Irish pub and bar. Less authentic feeling because they focus on the US sports team aspect.

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States

eFfQAVxn9chAjTvrhWslBQ.text: As someone who's uncle owned an Irish Pub back in the day, I am so trying to like this place.  After a bad experience a couple years back I decided to give it another try.  What I experienced on a Saturday night was deplorable.  Just as before, the service was anything but the friendly, welcoming atmosphere that goes with real Irish pubs.  Bartenders don't have to have a big phony smile but neither do they have to act like taking a simple drink order for one person is a huge, painful ordeal.  Then, as I was watching a closely contested sporting contest on one of their TVs, the place without warning turned into a cheesy dance club complete with unnecessarily risque and provocative images across the TV screens and songs with distasteful lyrics.   This type of objectification of women has no place in an establishment that advertises itself as an Irish pub.  Not surprisingly, it seemed to attract some low level rift raft with poor manners and objectionable attitudes.  After a previous bad review, management did respond and asked for some feedback.  I'm ready to offer that now.  My feedback is this.  Close this place down!  Right now!  Okay that's a bit extreme.  How about then changing the name at least away from an Irish Pub?  As a gesture of goodwill, I'm come up with a number of suggestions for a new name.  The Place Where Everyone Goes for Free Parking Validation Douchebag Central Schitzgerald's Too Lazy to Walk to the Epicenter Charlotte Home for the Surly, Unhappy Bartender The Trump Dump And my personal favorite, Craplebees

Qh0GDRfpj8M4sBdzgRm71g.text: Can I give this place 10 stars!  We had the most amazing experience at this joint.   The staff is friendly, the food was phaaaaaay nominal.   Our bartendress Alex makes the experience that much better.   She really sells the brand.   Definitely would fly to Charlotte again just for the experience.   Awesome job to everyone on the Fitzgerald's staff!   Bravo! Bravo!

gPNltJCwLX2oZnlXQLeRgg.text: It's hard to think of this place as something other than Buckhead so I think it is often over looked. qyo0o_x9-E1UaSclJ7I2VQ.text: We stopped in on a Friday night at 6:15. We had tickets to an 8pm show at Belk. Seems doable, right? Well, imagine or surprise when at 7:40, we still had no food and worse yet, no sympathy from our waitress. It took us telling her that we needed food or we were leaving for her to finally produce something from the kitchen. The food that came out was worse than the service... Pitiful turkey sliders with a smear of browning guacamole on top that looked like snot, rubbery boneless chicken wings and cold fries. The only thing I'd consider eating again is the fried mozzarella (hand cut & breaded according to the menu). Needless to say, we will not be back and advise you fine folks to stay away! There are way too many fantastic restaurants nearby (Merts, Roosters, BLT Steak, etc. etc.) to suffer through Fitzgeralds.

Xfj1WIDCdV-wPx2Ne-fJAQ.text: This is only a review for a Sunday during football season as that's the only time I've been there. We were in town and wanted a Steelers bar to watch the wild card game. _3XAEmaJyiiXzIxXWxHnbQ.text: This place gets an additional star for location. Right next to TimeWarner Arena and a big parking deck.  James & I stopped in here for a beverage and appetizer prior to the Bobcats and Jazz.  It was busy but we got seated quickly and the service was friendly and professional. We had the  grilled chicken tenders which were good.  An easy walk less than five minutes to the arena. They also have a agreement with the Wake Forest parking garage, free validation from 5p to 3a daily.

bmsHjuO8292KSQS8WoE_Kw.text: Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! I've only lived in Charlotte a few months and luckily I found this place not long after moving. The friendly staff already know my name and the bartenders are quick to ask me for a drink if they haven't poured my favorite already. Fitz is my go-to spot before or during Hornets games. Right in the heart of Uptown, you really feel the excitement on game days since Fitz is just a short walk from the newly re-named Spectrum Center. Great spot for any and every football game as well, college or professional! Fitz has a plethora of TVs always on the most popular games and great appetizers and entrees to enjoy during all 4 quarters.  Just save yourself the trouble of trying to decide what to order and grab a Fitz Platter-- wings, chicken tenders, mozzarella sticks, sliders, and fried pickles. Also grab an order of buffalo chicken dip, you won't regret it. Fitz has one of the best reuben sandwiches I've ever had, but if you're feeling bold, try the Shillelagh burger-- a burger with a reuben on top. Guy Fieri would be proud. Nice drink specials daily, $6 burger lunch on Thursdays, and if you're looking for a late-night spot Uptown, Fitz has you covered there as well! Trivia every Wednesday night and DJs Friday and Saturday nights. Noticed one reviewer knocked Fitz as being "the place everyone goes for free." Hmmm.... why would you not? Fitz is one of the largest bars in Uptown and forces no cover on you for entry. Of course I'd rather go to Fitz for free, instead of paying $10 to get inside a place smaller than my bedroom like The Local or Connolly's. That's just common sense, and not a negative but a positive for Fitz in my opinion. Fitz has enough room to be a bar, dance floor, and dining room all at the same time if it wanted. While being there, I've seen several rooms reserved for private events like after work happy hours at a private bar, or one of the dining rooms reserved for a big game watch party. If you're ever looking for a nice event space, I'd definitely recommend giving Fitzgerald's a call. They have plenty of room to accommodate your needs.  Bottom line: Fitzgerald's has everything I'm looking for in a local pub and more. 10/10 will go again!

bdM8HVLouKAJejXZrO2Bcw.text: This is a cool little joint to come to and grab a beer.  Relaxed atmosphere and can get pretty crazy and busy on the weekends.  The fact that Wake Forest is directly above it definitely helps that crowd.

4rZ2hp1umibOKX8ZrYrj3w.text: I was summoned to Charlotte from my humble, rocky hermit lair of Mt. Downey Jr., North Dakota for the wedding of two of my friends and decided I was in the mood for something to eat during the day before the wedding.  The idea of food in general is below me, there is literally no point.  In the literal sense. Literally.  You consume it only to need it again shortly.  I usually consist off a diet of heavy trade winds I keep in bottles and Mountain Dew Gamer Fuel (which doesn't count as food), so this is unusual indeed.  My comrades wanted authentic Irish and that is indeed what Fitzgerald's served up: Nachos with sour cream and chicken and guacamole, Fajitas with Beef and lettuce, and of course the staple Irish dish, a delicious cinnamon-sugar churro with a Corona Light to type it all off.  Baba O' Riley indeed!  If you're in the Charlotte area looking for authentic Irish look no further than Fitzgerald's for genuine and authentic Scottish food.

We asked for the manager and were told by her that the kitchen got stacked up and all she could do was apologize.  WOW! 3eAnx9uuUjNQepCSQg57lw.text: Stopped by here for lunch after appointment out in Waxhaw. This is a pretty cool bar. Lots of screen TV spread all over the bar with different sports games going on.  One would imagine an Irish Pub with bar food this is not the case here for they have variety of cuisines to select from,  Was going to go for the Lamb Kabob, but since it was windy and cold outside decided on the Fish and Chips. The beer batter was out of this world and the cod was chunky. Also ordered the Shepards Pie with tasted like a nice beef stew.  Will be back to try other items on their menu.

_iYHZ6iJpH4T9knGdSCErw.text: Fun sports bar. This is the official Penn State bar, so I've come here a couple times now with my bf who's an alumni. Not sure if this is just a game day thing, but they have beer towers (~100 oz of beer in this cute little dispenser) of Yuengling, Miller, Blue Moon, etc for $20-22!!!!! That's like 6-7 beers right at your disposal! I've never seen this before so I think it's pretty neat. All the booths have TV's with the games playing that are built-in, which is also super neat.  As for food - it's pretty decent bar food. The boneless wings are good and I've also had the Carolina burger. Not very Carolina-y or particularly tasty, but good enough. Sweet potato fries were pretty standard, a little soggy. The atmosphere is pretty fun for night games - there was a DJ playing good tunes and we were partying everywhere. Overall a good place to watch football games and have fun.

TnRW3tcp82FC6WOA9hIX-w.text: Quite possible the worst food I've had in Charlotte.  Sent the crab dip back THREE DIFFERENT TIMES for being cold. Anyone knows that crab dip should burn your mouth the first bite lol.  This stuff was nearly room temperature. The salad we ordered was nearly SOUP due to the amount of dressing and the wings were barely done and I asked for them crispy.  Bar staff was nice. Will never eat here again.

H0tvkgU2kRHPwgDqdxL4Ag.text: My family and I went here before a concert at Spectrum. We were able to sit outside which was a blessing because the inside was a mess. We sat ourselves because the hostess was completely overwhelmed. When it looked settled, we went inside to ask for menus and to remind them we sat ourselves on the patio. 20 min later... our drink orders were taken. 20 min later... we got our drinks. My moms hard apple cider  came in a dirty glass with stuff floating in it. So yeah..   Surprisingly our food came out faster than our drinks. I ordered the pork sliders. They were okay. Nothing special.    I wouldn't recommend this place to a friend.

ydyE6IByC_XyvUNIxzYGIw.text: I have been to Fitz ' s on many occasions before or after other event s uptown and just realized I had not previously written a review.   So... my most recent visit was after the Imagine Dragons concert at TWC arena. Tim & I were hungry as we didn't have time to grab dinner before the concert.   We got a booth and & started to check out the menu. I forgot how limited the late night menu is here.  We ended up getting a order of fried cheese & chicken tenders.    I gotta say, the fried cheese was just terrible! Not only did it have the appearance & consistency of frozen crud, it also tasted as if it had been fried in old oil that had been used to cook fish.  Yuck! It was so bad that  Tim sent it back & he never does that!  Thankfully the chicken was much better in texture & flavor - no yucky fishy taste.  The sauce was meh though - I got BBQ sauce and thought it was too thick & just didn't have a great flavor.   The service was pretty good and we did not have to wait long for food or drinks to come out. All in all, a good place to go for bevvies but they could stand to make improvements in the late night menu.

aNsdhZgg4yibYG0ZUgt4vg.text: World Series game 7 and these clowns are playing a basketball game on every screen. When we asked if they were going to play the series they said only on our booth screen and with no sound. They were also out of about 25% of the beers we tried to order.

zfCvtEUpR3iB2Nox2bCAoQ.text: Come here periodically, food is always good, solid bar food! Tonight was a busy night and Clara* check my spelling* killed it. We had a large group but still great service! Will come back without hesitation.

L3FQfWvtDr8zCY6hoZr86w.text: We visited on a Saturday night and were pleasantly surprised when they could quickly accommodate a party of 8 quickly. The atmosphere is very casual and there are lots of tvs around the dining room.   Our server was friendly and efficient. The menu had traditional Irish fare and American fare too. There was also a large selection of draft beers on tap and you could order special layered beers too like snakebites and Black and Tans.   We tried the fried pickles, Chicken sliders and fries. Others in our party enjoyed the kabobs, Mac and cheese, spinach, mashed potatoes and a wrap. We all enjoyed our food and the portions were very plentiful. If we had not been staying in a hotel we would have leftovers for the next day.   The fried pickles were specially good and very reasonably priced at $6. The pickles were thick cut, breaded with corn meal and served with ranch dressing.   They also had a new cocktail list that looked good. I tried the Gaelic punch (they couldn't make my first choice) and it was so delicious I ordered a second.   Overall, the food and drinks were good, as was the service. We would definitely go back and maybe sit outside if the weather is nice.

V5BFlLrGowTA8GaqE51YhA.text: I live in Uptown Charlotte , and Fitzgerald's is one of my go-to places, but they outdid themselves on Mothers Day today! I had the perfect pre-theater lunch accompanied by great Mimosas and even greater service! Thank you Courtney for making it a special day!

-0ijCJkAm-MShw773OTdfw.text: This is a solid 3 stars in my opinion. There is nothing special about it but also nothing to complain about. I work at Hearst tower so we go in after work often. The appetizer sampler is great for a group and they usually have decent beers on tap.

moRvnfMA45ZI2GB9cwexAA.text: Let me tell you about an amazing experience that went south because of a bartender at this establishment. I came to Fitzgerald's in Friday afternoon, March 16, with some friends. We had an amazing bartender, Tom, and I had a very enjoyable time. So, when a few friends suggested returning there on March 17, saint patricks day, it was a no brainer for me. The music was amazing, the drinks were flowing, and the people were beyond words. I was having an amazing time. The food at this place is good, so i decided to order some French fries and chicken. I asked the bartender how much the chicken  was, and he told me it was $10. I had the fries earlier, so I knew they were $3. When I got my bill, $16, I asked what happened. Simple math shows that $13 plus tax isn't $16. Now, it isn't a lot of money, but everyone works hard for what they spend, and when you ask about pricing, that's what you expect it to be. He scoffed at me and said " what, am I suppose to know the price of everything here?"  This idea is a novel one as he is an employee. Nonetheless, I paid the man, moved on, and tipped the bartender that bought me ketchup.  That's when it started. I waited for 25 minutes for a drink as he literally served everyone around me. When I called the other bartender, the one I had previously tipped, he told her not to serve me and then she refused to take my drink order. It took a stranger walking up and ordering my drink for me to get one. I would like to note that I was the ONLY African American in that area at the time. When another gentleman(African American), he also had to wait a long time for this bartender to pay him any attention. I digress. When I finally got his attention, and I said to him " hey, I've been waiting a while to order a drink," he made a vulgar motion  to me and then said so what, and carried on. Truthfully, I would like to say that this is the worse part, but it's not going to be. I plan to call a manager on Monday, but let's face it; they won't do anything about this. I even mentioned it to a manager there at the time, and he said " I don't know," and then kept walking. The other major issue is that this is a common occurrence here in Charlotte. I find that establishments such as these aren't held to the same standards of good customer service and DECENCY that I am used to back home. Does it disgust me that he treated his African American clients so poorly?  Does it disgust me that even after reporting it and writing a review, nothing will come of this?  No!  What disgusts me is that establishments no longer care that their people treat all other people as simple human beings. This was my first time to Fitzgerald, and sadly, it will be my last!!

cbBwEpXvJwUefGXzpKXZSQ.text: Here's my experience at Fitzgerald's: we were seated.  We waited 30 minutes for a waitress to take our order, but they were all busy flirting with guys at the bar. We left unnoticed. If I could give 0 stars I would. Honestly, I've gotten better service at the NC DMV.  Good for those guys at the bar though!

EpSMYNyol2yHV5XuVBOUyw.text: Nothing special but fine for a quick beer or a burger.  We sat at the bar, bartenders were friendly enough, when you can hunt them down.

hqlBbC4t8d7iyJmyIuMniw.text: Stopped in here for the UNC/Duke game.  Easily found a spot and met some friends.  The pub ambiance works well.  The restaurant is actually huge.  I was really surprised to see all of the space that they have because it doesn't feel big from the outside.  We basically just had beers and apps.  I expected a broader beer menu with some local choices but that wasn't really the case.  Nonetheless, the beer special of the night was $3 pints.  That's totally acceptable.  The only food we got was pretzel bites.  They came with queso and beer mustard.  Overall, I was pleased.  It was a pretty big basket and we were certainly satisfied.  The service was hit or miss.  Our waitress was pretty flighty.  I would return to Fitzgerald's.  It's not terribly fru-fru which I appreciate.

Z7INnF9bpzq--sfMTqhlrw.text: This is a beautiful, big space with tons of TV's!  Even better...it's a Steeler's Bar!  They have a DJ that works during commercials.  The staff is friendly & on top of service.  They have Woodchuck on tap as well as Harp, Guinness & Smithwick's.  They also have a nice patio on the front of the restaurant.  The food looked decent, but basically bar food & we just went for drinks & the game, so I can't comment on the quality of it.  BONUS!!!  They validate your parking in the garage attached to their building!

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Original w/a Twist as a regular size burger.
Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States

42HvECECH5ABxnaW7VJuOQ.text: So what use to be Buckhead is now Fitzgerald's.  Honestly, I walked in and was like "nothing here has changed".  Maybe there are a few more TV's?  That being said nothing really needed changing.  It's a decent place to grab a bit and watch the game if you have the chance.  They also do an all you can eat crab leg night (I think it's Wed?) and all though I haven't had the oppurtunity to try it out I plan to.    Touted as an irish pub I really don't get that feeling of anything relative to an irish pub while I'm there.  Maybe that's just me.

vqfjXluly7hNogKS8Bduwg.text: Typically always a fun, lively atmosphere. I tend to travel here a lot before Charlotte Checkers games or after work for for their happy hour, which is half-priced apps til 6 or 7pm. And I really like that they validate parking after 5pm - a rariety in Uptown!  The happy hour is full of variety with plenty of options.The nachos plate is huge and definitely something to share. Smaller apps, like the ahi tuna or chicken fingers, are great for single serve. The only thing I've ever been turned off by has been the fried pickles. They taste as though they are simply tossed in flour and fried til brown... no seasoning to really speak of and a lack of flavor. But everything else is good to snack on!  My only complaint, and the reason for the 3 stars, is the service. I've been here no less than a dozen times and each time I typically get mediocre service and a few times, just down right rude servers. Coming from the service industry, if you are busy, no problem and I get it.   One insistance my friends and myself traveled to Fitz to start our Saturday night. The server was busy, which caused for slow service, but was friendly and you could tell she was trying. The manager James saw my friend in a birthday tiara and served us a round of shots - props to James for being awesome sauce! I still go here a good bit but know that if I have somewhere to be at a certain point, I usually dine elsewhere.

7QU5pvkOHjodao96tHuptA.text: I've been visiting Fitzgerald's for a quite some time as my son Nick Cromer is the General Manager of the location in Charlotte. Now many people will calm nepotism for this review but I will remain objective. The food has always been served and presented well. My favorites are the chicken wrap and the spinach dip. If you really want to have a cheat day try the buffalo cheese dip. The bar service has been on point as the bartenders are very attentive about checking on your drink even when they are slammed with customers.  If you get a chance to go down town and are looking for a place for a bite to eat and a pint ask for Nick and enjoy your time at Fitzgerald's!

WsgY5CPm52MlMOOZiODdyw.text: In town from Florida and stopped by for lunch on a recommendation from a friend.  I had the pretzel bites for a appetizer and BBQ burger both dishes excellent! The manager Nick Cromer came by my table and it turns out he is from Florida too, what a nice young man, very knowledgeable on the area and sports. I am bringing my family back up right after Christmas and will be sure to stop back.

L6D7BCGBhr3N1E-vcTP-aw.text: Although it is a plastic paddys, it was a high energy plastic paddys last Saturday night.  We had lots of drinks and enjoyed watching the people and having our kidney stones pulverized by the driving bass.  Nobody singin about Danny Boy or how much they hate  the fuckin Brits in this joint!  We had fun but, if you are gonna call yourself an Irish pub, do something Irish.

s6CD8kiL_0iPzPUJIyv8rw.text: I was actually pretty impressed with this place! I had been drinking prior so my taste buds probably aren't 100% accurate but I thought the pretzel bites and mozzarella bites were extremely tasty! Awesome atmosphere with lots of space! Don't have to worry about finding a seat and the dance floor is pretty cool. Too bad I didn't find this place early! And apparently the parking is free next door if u eat there

aeLgtavyBjPKZVLuqjLtBQ.text: I love the remodel that was done, the decor change from the old Buckhead Saloon turned out really well.  However, the decor has changed, but it appears to be the same old Buckhead crowd (those that have just turned 21 or maybe 22 and are ready to drink till they throw up).  This is a great place to drink, but I wouldn't recommend it as somewhere to enjoy a dinner.  The music is very, very loud and the patrons are usually extremely drunk.  I've been here twice and every time I sit at the bar someone ends up spilling their drink on me in some fashion :)  I went to watch a Panther's pre-season game, but with the dj playing it really wasn't a very memorable experience.  I figured that at 8pm on a Saturday, they'd have the sound on for the tvs, but there was a dj playing and he had the volume cranked up at full force.  Warning: The layout is kinda weird, so when there's a crowd, be prepared to push and shove your way through a sea of people to get to the restrooms (which are located at the very back).

9IgC87EGvC_cFR0BNRrlZw.text: After an awesome Checker's game, our group decided to grab some  beer from somewhere nearby. We wound up at Fitzgerald's. The place was so slammed we couldn't even find a spot a the bar. After standing around and waiting for someone to clear out, we were lucky enough to get a table near the dj.   Beer was expensive, as to be expected downtown, but the spectacles were ceaseless. That is a GREAT place to people watch and have some laughs with your friends. The music was far too loud though; it made everyone succumb to a shouting match. The closer to midnight we approached, the dimmer the lights became, and people started dancing. This was hilarious! Good times... I left there in a happy mood, and recall fondly that great evening!

-rrG-m9aJ1Yg_LlqgafY_w.text: Have you been to Stool Pigeons, Picasso's, or Fox and Hound Lately? Then you have been to Fitzgerald's only their dinner and drink service are not up to par. This place has zero zing... zero. There is nothing special about it and no reason other than the free parking to have a drink or eat there. Their best drink special of the day, a $3 Blue Moon, ran out by 8:15 on opening night and it wasn't nearly as busy as I have seen the old Buckheads get. .   The first Blue Moon I drank had an overwhelming taste/scent of onion as if someone cut an Orange with the safe knife or cutting board as they used to chop onions...gross. I did ask the server about it and so my second (yes I braved another) actually tasted much better.   I ordered the shrimp entree for $11.95. This was definitely an appetizer portion. I was served ten shrimp which were not very large on an appetizer plate with a side of cut up onions with a dash of mealy tomatoes and three small pieces (half of my pinky size) of browned avocado. I couldn't taste the lime and it was very-much under-seasoned. Eating a plate of mushy onions was not appetizing and therefore it mostly remained untouched on my plate. I didn't complain because I already felt bad for the onion-beer complaint but it was fairly obvious my side wasn't touched. The food quality was unacceptable.   Service was ok for a first night and I'm sure she probably was more than a bit nervous. A more nuanced server might have thought to comp the first beer or notice my side was still glaringly on my appetizer/entree plate...but I won't fault her too much since it was their grand opening and therefore an expected learning curve.  I will say the place looked nicer than Buckheads which is definitely a plus. I hope they get better...a lot better.

saPnJKJA8_OzDADVgGHkIA.text: I got the blackend parm wings and my only mistake was not ordering 20 of these bad boys.  They are some of my favorite in the area

iij1wiXlYbsx7Vp5nhtahQ.text: I ordered the Southwestern burger with coleslaw. The burger wasn't anything special and I had asked the waitress if the coleslaw was a creamy coleslaw (she said yes) and it was dry and...yuck.  I didn't eat it.  Overall I wasn't impressed with the food and it appears to be a place people go just for it's pub culture and location.

4289kD1O2K8Q8V6WjYti-w.text: I was quite excited to try out the new pub that used to be Buckheads though skeptical that they would be able to remove all of the peanut shells likely left behind.  However, their remodeled interior was beautiful!  Instead of small tables used for standing only, there are full tables that can accomadate large parties and multiple new booths along the windows.  I was also impressed that for an uptown location, they offer free parking at a parking garage right next door!  Just make sure to bring your parking ticket into the restaurant so you can have them make a punch mark.    The menu is extensive and the pricing is reasonable ($7.95 and up).  I was disappointed that the only drink specials on their grand opening night was draft beer.  Bleh.  I took advantage of the $3 Blue Moon but by 8 PM we were informed that they had run out.  Not very good planning!  In the future, I'd like to try out their "Luckitini's" which are cutely priced at $7.77.    On to the food, as I mentioned, the menu is full of options.  A lot of it is typical pub fare like fish and chips, chicken caesar wraps, burgers, nachos, etc.  I sampled their sweet potato fries and had some of the beer battered fish and chips.  The sweet potato fries were cooked just like I love - not crisp but lightly coated with butter and salt.  The beer battered fish was quite tastey and came with a side of tarter.  The platter had 2 ample sized pieces of fish so you'll walk out full!  The service was attentive.  We were immediately greeted when we walked in by multiple hostesses and our server checked in often.    If you are looking to watch a game, you won't be disappointed.  There were TV's in every direction I turned my head.    Overall, Fitzgerald's gave me exactly what I expected.  I wasn't disappointed but it didn't leave me feeling like it was anything special.  I was hoping for somethng different, and unique in uptown Charlotte instead it is a cookie cutter pub.  I'd go back but I wouldn't say I HAVE to go back.  It's definitely a lot better than what it used to be so thanks Fitzgeralds for taking us up a notch!

Lgc_8CVEWA5gMNYgRCiItg.text: Made a quick stop here. The server was quick to take our order and friendly, but the execution of service was a bit off. I ordered my drink, but got another one, and then when I got the one I originally wanted it didn't taste right. I'm a mojito connoisseur and this one was watered down, lacked fresh limes, and the fizz couldn't be found...how they could even serve it was beyond me. Needless to say, I enjoyed my company and the patio, but while everyone else was sipping on their beverage I was either waiting on mine or correcting it.

Yjn35d9BEvFcUgmZdLoVzg.text: Fitzgerald's is a solid Pub to grab a drink before going to an event/game uptown. The beer list isn't extensive but they have some decent options. Their food and service are both average.

gmAEvMEx2mXwFL_dRFfTbQ.text: Poor service. Poor quality food. Discussed specifics with manager. Indifferent attitude. For example wing appetizer was dried out. Sauce was flavorful but dry.  Explained my dissatisfaction to manager his response was "some of our customers like Krispy wings.  Ok. So they are aware they cater to the overcooked Krispy wing crowd.

YKpQKXWEouHWZMOvRK2bMQ.text: Not impressed, which is unfortunate, because this is a great place close to the arena and other downtown venues, but not in the icky, overcrowded Epicenter.  I visited after an event at the arena, and was treated to sub-par service, and was told "sit anywhere" in the nearly empty pub, then kicked out of my table of choice because it was "reserved", despite there not being any sign of it being off limits.  Servers were mediocre, but it is a new place and they are probably still learning the ropes (like how to pronounce the Irish beer Smithwicks properly).    I just wasn't impressed, at all.  When you put the name "Irish" in your name, I expect more than a place that serves Guinness... the decor is very sleek and modern, but there is nothing sleek or modern about a True Irish pub.  My Smithwicks was served in a glass advertising some cheap, American beer.    The food was OK.  I was impressed they had vegetarian chili on the menu, and it was quite tasty, but nothing stood out from any of the five people's orders in my party.  Overall, it's just a really generic bar that's not a sports bar, or an Irish pub, or anything at all that would stand out in a crowd.  It reminded me of a hotel bar... you know, the kind that is just kind of convenient, but nothing out of the ordinary?  Because they are a sponsor of my favorite sports team, I may give them a second chance, but all in all, it's a pretty forgettable and bland establishment.

zj0TCBEGd0FvGFrvr9GImw.text: Awesome place, tons of TVs, the food is okay and nice drink specials. The service is great, the bartenders are all really cool and hot which is also a plus. Since it's not a corporate restaurant, I don't understand why the waitresses don't dress more attractive. It's like a sports bar vibe and the the waitresses are all very attractive but their clothes aren't. Not saying they should look like Hooters girls but at least show a little skin!

fUkZLDmHnQC2WTMznjc2dw.text: I've been here before and was always pleased with the food, service and atmosohere. Today we only got 2 out of 3. The corned beef on the  Reuben was extremely tough and chewy. The cod sandrwich was greasy. New chef? Unsure if I'll go back again.

_U-8zApYMHIciKtX3TimpQ.text: This is a great place to watch sports at with reasonable prices and good food and drinks!

B-11345ED_wgO6DaunDiNg.text: I was here with a large group for dinner. The atmosphere has a nice Irish pub feel and I suppose it's a lively place on some nights. The food however was just bad. I had a hamburger I ordered it medium it came well done borderline charred. I ate what I could. The fries were soggy too. I saw other people in our group send food back too. I am giving two stars only because the service was great. It's a shame the food is such a disaster. They need a new chef.

B5uuzJ3H7RfuEAw0jShhjA.text: I hope we caught them on an off night..  After walking around for about a half an hour trying to find a restaurant to grab dinner and drinks at before seeing a show at the Time Warner Cable Arena on a Sunday night we found Fitzgerald's which looked like an Irish Sports Bar with a great outside patio area.  We made our way to the hostess stand and asked if we could sit outside, the hostess looked very overwhelmed and wasn't even aware that there were tables outside hat were open. We made our way over to the tables and pushed them together and waited for someone to come clean them off - after about 5 minutes we sat down and pushed all the dirty dishes/glasses/checks to the end of the table. We had to go up and ask for a waitress twice and finally someone came over and took our order - leaving the dirty items and without wiping the table off. Our waitress came back a few minutes later to inform one of the members of our group that their beer choice was out, but didn't bring anyone else their drinks...  Our waitress then took our dinner orders and finally brought our beers, the member of our group who had who's original choice was out, received their drink with sentiment floating around and setting at the bottom...  Food was decent but the whole experience left a bad impression on all of us,I doubt anyone will return to this establishment if we are in the Charlotte area again.

04Vg4gxAh1SrXNGvA62oTQ.text: The food was great except for sandy spinach.  The manager contacted me and explained the issue was related to a last minute supplier.  Adding a star as this was the only thing keeping them from it.    I appreciate good management!

rQvIifLEnUhCwQhc0i2MUg.text: Service was phenomenal our waitress was Kara! Very welcoming to us new in Charlotte. Will come back when we visit!

IRmqqhqWcB4E8gmoOg2Ntg.text: We had a party of about 60ish people with a reservation. we were able to get in a little early and they accommodated our group very well. Service was fanaminal, door was brought out in a timely fashion. No orders were goofed. all the staff were so nice and would chat. This IS a place I will come back to.

N0X67r660Atr9rUN4pUDVg.text: I came here for lunch on a Thursday around 1:45 to avoid the lunch rush. They were not busy, but the service was slow. I skimmed the menu (bar food), but found out it was 'burger day'. All of their burgers were on special: $6 for half pound burgers and $5 for third pound burgers. I got the half pound Gouda mushroom burger with a side of broccoli. I ordered it medium, but it came out very well done. It was a little dry, but overall pretty good. Nothing to rave about. I can't complain because it was only $6 (and huge!), but if I paid full price I would be a little let down. Tip: order your burger medium-rare if you want a juicy burger.   I recommend coming here when they have specials. Other than that it's your typical bar/restaurant so don't expect a 5 star meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gouda mushroom burger with broccoli
Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States. $5 &amp; $6 burgers on Thursday.

B6gXG9ureryM9Cp9Mg5N7A.text: I meant to post this last week after the Justin Timberlake concert. My boyfriend and I decided to get tickets last minute so we were already running late and traffic was awful. We were finally able to find a spot in Fitzgerald's parking deck and saw signs that they validate inside. Very convenient! When we got inside it was jammed pack and every table was taken and the bar was backed up and full but somehow we managed to get drinks in less than minutes. Kudos barstaff! My real amends goes to a female manger. My boyfriend and I were in awe of her work ethic. She found us a small table and bussed it herself. I was so worried the food would take too long and we would have to leave without eating but it only took 15 mins or so for three separate apps! Kudos kitchen! The manger came back around with some waters for us and she must have been able to tell by the panic on my face that I felt like I needed to rush and she held out her phone and showed me the concert schedule... JT didn't actually go on for another hour and a half! I was so thankful. I was able to relax and enjoy my food and drinks. While my boyfriend and I continued to sit there we watched as this selfless manager ran countless trays of food, bussed tables, bartended, barebacked stocking bar items, and handled manager duties with waitresses checks at their computer station. I mean I've never seen anything like it. All in all well done to the entire establishment. I take my hat off to your entire staff! We appreciate the hard work and excellent service. We will be back no questions asked!

EDwZjaxMJyZCuiqp8uSxww.text: Don't waste your time! Ordered a drink.... flat and tasteless!  Bartender was more interested in taking with his buddy at the end of the bar and flirting with all the girls coming in than tend bar!   The special Bloody Mary came with no olive or celery it tasted like crap but I got to sit and listen to the Bartender talk crap about some customer who left his credit card referring to him as "dick head" while he kissed and hugged some under age appearing female patron!  Must be the reason there was only six people in the place!  I'm never coming here again!

nH-XHkgSAuj8_uQ98ibq9w.text: I visited Fitzgeralds for the first time this past weekend. I was impressed! From the outside it looks like a small Irish pub but looks can be deceiving! It's much bigger than I imagined on the inside!   I can't speak for the food just yet since we only went for late night fun but I'll definitely be trying it soon!   But as for late night, I had a blast. The dj was awesome and he had the videos playing to the music all over the bar. He played some great throwback along with top 40. There were good specials going on and the bartenders were really friendly. We just danced all night which is just what you need sometimes!   We loved it so much we got tickets to the NYE party! So excited for this!

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States

hd00vXFQ_VGuGzdwv0awVQ.text: Slow service! Football games are on, and if you're in a booth, you have a personal TV!  Coming here during lunch might be a better bet than coming here on game day. Our service was beyond horrendous and we had to ask our server (or any server we could find for that matter) about our drink order several times before it coming over. We were about to leave, right as the drinks came over-- talk about convenient.   It would be hard for me to reccomend this place or even come back here at all. I was so appulded with the lack of service, even before sitting down, that we should have walked through that door.

GqadcJuqZdBbszXLHLPOWQ.text: In town visiting from Atlanta and came by Fitzgerald's. They have great food options, although I wasn't too pleased with the quinoa cranberry salad (too bland in my opinion) and the Shepard's pie (not what I expected). Our waitress, Stephanie, was absolutely amazing and had great customer service! My mom, who is very picky with her drinks, ordered their margarita and was very pleased. Overall, good place to drop by.

pjX_d0kR2WdOVZgrTOMFeg.text: Great place to meet and watch sports. Even better place to go after the Panthers game.  Highly recommend.

9hj1C4f7L0LIIBTgij7w6w.text: If I could rate this no stars I would. The bouncer here broke my little brothers phone. My brother is only 21 and was being threatened by the bouncers for doing nothing. Security is a problem here!

IglCyD56-raNbhbpab7Dpg.text: I came here because this was a spot to meet for a bar crawl.   Me and the boyfriend ordered the sampler/appetizer platter and it was HUGE. Me and the boyfriend were definitely satisfied. We ordered beers with no complaints. Nice and cool in a clean glass.  Service was average.   I don't really have much to say, not because it wasn't good- there isn't anything special about this spot. I think everyone has that go to spot where you get what you need, nothing more and nothing less... This is one of those places.   I will say that if you're into people watching, this is a great spot to eat outside.

kYc8awUaqtPf7qhxhtAWjA.text: Wow. Words can't explain the love I have for this establishment. Would recommend for ANYONE. I'm talking people here for a quick visit, people new to Charlotte, or people looking for a new regular spot. Great food and great people. SARAH IS THE BEST SERVER OF ALL TIME. NO ONE CAN SERVE LIKE SHE CAN! Everytime I've eaten there I've seen Kyle (the general manager) or Kevin(the owner) walking around with the most approachable and friendly smiles! They are always there to help and make my already EXTREMELY pleasant experience there even better. The nightlife is even better. If you're looking for an better than best Irish car Bomb or any liquid libations ask for Zane, Marissa, or Alexa. I love this place. Highly recommend.

Uc6-JD_ygIKf-Chl6fNJww.text: I've been trying to update some of my older reviews lately. While on the book of face today, I saw a flier for Fitz's three year anniversary party and thought it was time to re-visit this one.   Why this place wins: it's the closest restaurant/bar to TWC Arena AND they validate parking for the Wake Forest Garage. So, don't throw your garage ticket on the dashboard and remember to bring it inside with you. And when you bring it inside, don't forget to ask your server or bartender to validate the ticket for you.  Leaving the arena after a big event is always a pain, but especially know because of all the construction outside. I'll usually walk over to Fitz's for a drink after a game or show and wait for the traffic to clear. The patio is fantastic for people watching.  Menu-wise, I think the food has gotten better over the years. I usually order the Drop-Kick Chicken Sandwich. Buffalo sauce and bleu cheese make everything delicious. App wise I go with pretzel bites (beer mustard and queso dipping sauce FTW) and the wings. I mix hot and teriyaki sauces. I haven't had the chipotle mango, but it's next on my list to try.  Service can be hit or miss here. I've had good and not so good experiences here. This is a Penn State and Steelers bar. Steeler Sundays are nuts. Get there early. They also have IC Light for game day.  Looking at how this place has developed and changed over the past three years, I  would say this place is somewhere between a 3.5 and 4. I think they've earned that extra star.

IguZk2Le5sz1B44pBeUvWw.text: erica is awesome and is quite literally the best server in charlotte..... angie is cool too... i guess.

saqZryk6V1C-VPvQ5lk0tQ.text: Always a fun place to stop by when I'm in this area of uptown. I've been coming for several years, and the friendly service has always remained the same. There are two bar areas and tons of TVs to whatever 'the game' happens to be at the time. Lots of local beers on tap as well. My go-to dish here is a spicy (buffalo) chicken wrap. Bonus: they will validate your parking if you stop inside and make a purchase.

uvrLXRsv3pcW_bGO6dudxw.text: I wish I could tell you about my experience here, but I didn't have one.  While waiting for a table, I grabbed a drink from the bar.  Unfortunately, this process was cumbersome - at best - since half the yuppies in Uptown were using the bar / stools / floor as space to lay their jackets / bags / laptops as they stand in crowds around the now-obsolete bar seating.  Once seated, I became a ghost.  Like a wind-swept trinket buried in the desert sands, the longer I waited, the more forgotten my existence.    I attribute this to a complete lack of professionalism on behalf of the server(s) who made little effort to actually work and maximum effort to socialise with friends at the bar.  Secondary to this is a hostess who, against all odds, exerted inhuman levels of apathy in rectifying this issue as it unfolded before her very eyes.  Total garbage, -10 out of 10, more like "Shitzgerald's".

TimEyW871b7h48qtRz5Lgg.text: Another first! Went a walk and came across here! Walked in and they were very friendly and the place was cool. It was hot outside!  Stop to have a beer and the bartender was a sweetheart! Good service and cold beer. I would recommend it here.

Br2x_uyiKOiJug5yznVj6g.text: Absolutely one of the most friendliest and attentive restaurants I've been in. And I'm not just saying that because it's a Steelers / Penn State bar (although it does add some positive personal points). The owner Kyle genuinely cares about his guests and employees which is very difficult to find in the food industry. Most places you don't even know who the owner is let alone see him on the floor working with a smile. You can tell this family cares deeply about the service they provide and the people that come through their doors. And I haven't even gotten to the quality of the food yet. Our server Frank is the perfect amount of attentive and even went the extra mile to make sure we didn't get our food served late. Long story short, I will be back!

E78vhG55ExqcVg1rJLO33w.text: Well, this is the third time we've been very disappointed with what has been one of our favorite places. First, they had a very limited menu, because of the CIAA tournament. Then, we asked that our table top TV be turned to hockey. It never was. Our food came out quickly, but then, we never saw our server again until we were finished eating. No manager ever visited our table, and we weren't offered more drinks. It was just an all around disappointing evening. With so many other "pub" options in the city, I'm not sure we'll be back.

yLLN9s4MECDF8jans6_D4g.text: Right in downtown, not very authentic Irish Pub, but don't think they care much. Good service, bartender thought he was a rock star but the waitress later was really awesome and on her game. I'd like, as an Irish countryman , a little more homage to the homeland, but all in all, not a shitshow .

r07p1P565xp2SW1dR2Yk1w.text: I'm a fan of Fitzgerald's and so this place gets a slightly higher rating, but based on the reuben alone it would be a 1. It's a great place to drink and they do have some good food on the menu, but the reuben is not one of those things.  I continued my reuben adventure around Charlotte with a place I thought would have a good reuben, an Irish spot. I was quite wrong. The corned beef was terrible - it was this rubbery substance that was clearly boiled, poorly, and didn't have any flavor at all. The sandwich was soggy as the standard marbled rye wasn't crisped up at all, and the kraut just didn't add much to the sandwich as it lacked the proper tartness required. The sandwich was covered in melted cheese, but that can only do so much to make up for the rest of a bad sandwich.  Fitzgerald's is a good spot with decent food and a great atmosphere - just don't make the same mistake I did and order a reuben.

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Reuben from Fitzgerald&#39;s - with very rubbery corned beef

hpq5Bd45nleYVE2hahwciQ.text: Had a great experience at Fitzgerald's today. Stopped in before seeing a movie and was craving a burger. Highly recommend the A1 Burger- .   Decided to sit at the bar where Tom greeted me first thing. He let me sample the Sam Adam's 76 which was a tasty suggestion.   I will definitely be returning back to Fitzgerald's soon!

SLnCTNfQ7G4mp-VEtGEyqQ.text: Your typical uptown sports bar. No real glitz or glamour, but none needed either. Mostly have visited pre- or post-Hornets game for beverages. The couple times I have ordered food, it has been good bar food.  Service has always been good, no issues. Will probably be able to flesh out my review soon because my alumni association's football watch parties are going to be held here starting this year. I'll get back to you guys!

agYSllpyvdzuhJ0ubCRYIg.text: Great bar and grill tucked away in plain sight. It was pretty busy ahead of the ACC Championship game but the hostess found us a table and service was sharp all afternoon. Great food, good beer selection and great atmosphere. Plenty of screens so you won't miss your favorite game. We will be back every time we are in Charlotte.

rej__2dBnJsMPVimFCRtPg.text: My wife and I stopped in here for lunch during on of our many trips to Charlotte for NBA basketball. We frequently stay at the Holiday Inn down the street and can see loads of people enjoying Fitzgerald's and here the loud music every night. Judging from the amount of people who go there we figured Fitzgerald's must be ok and it was. We both got the fish and chips and everything was well prepared and the staff was super friendly. Nothing to jump up and down about but it was good and I do recommend checking this resturant out.

rkX7MuKR1uvMTDjyApKh_A.text: In Charlotte for work, worked until after 11, and was looking forward to stopping into Fitzgerald's for a drink since they stay open late.  According to their door, their website, yelp, Google, etc. they are open until 2.  Well, they were closed at 11:30 tonight.

i18q-XK7uLtFJRl4_Dlgwg.text: This place wasn't too shabby! Great environment to catch games and munch on some bar food. When I came here we sat at the back bar and the bartender was AMAZING. He was very attentive and personal!

M1E7WDH7LLhwWTOLWea3ag.text: Wonderful Experience! My friend was in town visiting and wanted to watch ALL of the football games in 1 spot and Fitz was the perfect spot for that after checking out 2 other nearby spots. Our server Ryan was a gem! He was so welcoming and helpful throughout the entire dining experience. The manager was so friendly and made us feel so welcomed. He even noticed the Falcons jersey my friend was wearing and changed one of the TVs to show the Falcons game! I will never understand why people give this place a bad review. The food is great, drinks are reasonably priced and the atmosphere is great! :)

-nm_JsR1HDa2McISmlGTKA.text: I recently visited Fitzgeralds on a Friday night with some friends. When going to the bar to order, I saw that they had a special that read "$3.50 Select Ales."  I ordered two, then watched as the bartender poured out two Miller Lites.  When she brought back the drinks, I explained that Miller Lite isn't an ale at all, but a pilsner (which is a style of lager.) She first asked "What's the difference?" When I explained the differences, she shrugged her shoulders and said, "That's just what we call it," then walked off.  Beers can be split up into two categories: lagers and ales. Lagers (which include pilsners) use a bottom-fermenting yeast and have what the casual drinker would describe as a "crisp" taste, and ales (which include IPAs, porters, and stouts) use a top-fermenting yeast.   Even to the average beer drinker, this doesn't make sense. Getting a Miller Lite when you order an ale is like getting a tuna sandwich after you ordered the caviar.  At best, this is marketing laziness, at worst it's an outright lie.

Nd_H3vpqwV12Gcz9sV2CYg.text: Swing through here for an early lunch while on a work trip. I was intrigued as they are part of the mileage dining plan.   I had the fried chicken sliders and French onion soup. The soup was good but a bit salty. The sliders however were great.   The staff was really friendly and it looks to be a great sports bar with all their TV's and lots of taps!

n2HFdzxXRY3A-khaSd4nPg.text: I dropped in to catch up with a college friend. It's pretty noisy during happy hour, but what do you except - it's HAPPY HOUR! It looks like all of the businessmen of the downtown area hangs out here right around 4:45-6pm.   My drinks were well-mixed and strong = score! They validate parking AFTER FIVE. vWYb2dWRuZLResj9E5IJnA.text: Great spot to pound a car bomb! The bartenders and service  here is always spot on.  I can't speak on the food,  other than it looked appetizing.  We seem to always end up here when we are walking around uptown.  There is never a cover charge and the drinks are cheap.

pTlWO7wwZATm8DzxQEu1Bg.text: I love Fitzgerald's as a weekend bar stop, but I think I'm going to have to check this one off completely as far as a lunch spot. I came here on Thursday to give their burger lunch special a shot ... $6 1/2lb & $5 1/3lb burgers.   To start our meal off, service was extremely slow. I was in about 1:45pm, after the lunch rush already had gone through, so this was pretty disappointing in and of itself. When I ordered my burger, I made sure to ask the waitress if the burger "temperature" was True to order, as they're usually always more well than you order. She assured me it was very True to order, so I went with medium cooked 'Shillelagh'. Burger came out with not one speck of pink in it .. but service was taking so long I didn't even bother sending it back or I would have been going on a 1.5 hour lunch break. The patty was so dry it ruined the burger for me complete, I ended up just eating the corned beef/saurkraut off of it and leaving half the patty.  Overall, very disappointed with lunch, and I definitely wouldn't recommend it for a good burger. Maybe I'll give something traditionally Irish a try next time and hope for the best.

9yXqgmeQnEDrB2-M0TApgw.text: This is a great late night spot. My family visited here after the Queen concert at the Spectrum Center. It's just across the street. The place is large but filled up quickly. They offer a big bathroom with lots of stalls which is nice. Our service was good. Our server was pretty slammed. We had a few Dos Equis Ambers and ordered some nachos (without chili)  and some pretzel bites. You get free pretzel bites with your Yelp checkin!!! The bites were okay and the nachos were amazing. It's a very relaxed atmosphere. And you can hang out here for a while and not feel like you need to hurry and eat and free the table out. It's a fun place.

Changed my review because as the owner said it wasn't their event. So I'll comment on my experience with the staff.   We're do I start the staff was awesome the food was awesome. dyetOhYakkCvDoFjNkXx-g.text: Came here on a Sunday with a group of about ten for the Steelers game.  Our server Emily did a great job, given a crazy football crowd and high demands of drinks.    If you're a Steelers fan or just want to grab a drink, this is the place for you. Standard bar food; wings, dips, sandwiches, salads, etc. I didn't order any food, but a few took others did at the table did and it took forever and ended up getting compt.   I had their $3 mimosa which was so heavy on the OJ and not even a nice pour in the wine glass. I also got a bucket of bud light which was $25. $25 for a bucket really?.... This place is a standard sports bar Uptown. It's large and has patio seating in the heart of uptown.

aOK47hdXbuHX3RpEBZHQxw.text: I've had the chance to check out a few of the nice sports bar in the local area; allow me to let you in on a pristine gem nestled right in the uptown area.   Fitzgerald's is a sports bar with just enough of an Irish twist to peak my interest on game day. When I walked in, the main room was extremely spacious with generous TV coverage end to end. The owner, Kyle, immediately welcomed our party and had us seated quickly.   Once we found a nice booth area, he inquired on which Games we'd want to watch, and ended up letting us split our viewing to an array of matchups which was most welcome considering we're fantasy football fanatics.  Throughout the day, we had mimosas, which I have yet to find a rival in the Charlotte area for. Poured quite strong, however they weren't offputting considering the ratio of OJ to champagne. This is how ALL mimosas should look; brunch spots take note!  The burger I ordered was cooked to my exact specification, and had a sauce that was extremely zingy and unique. Huge fan and must find out what comprises this sauce!  Overall, the servers were attentive and personable, the food was exceptional, and the owner was a very kind and hard-working individual; often carrying plates to customers himself and mingling in between encouraging his staff.  This MUST be your fantasy football headquarters outside of your own couch and TV!

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States

lle5xkYq7mWWq48rZcWr0A.text: This is a nice bar close to spectrum center. We stopped in for drinks and appetizer. My mule was delicious. Service was friendly and fast. I would definitely visit again. TV on each table, station on golf. I wonder if i could have changed the channel??

9eVAzXh-eL9PFpeRC1ysww.text: Angie is the hostess with the mostest. Super sweet staff. Alex was equally awesome. Good food...Good times!

CXgpkdiymiruWG1qh-TD8A.text: The two times that I've been here the food was decent.  They have great lunch specials Monday through Thursday.  But the last time we went, we ordered burgers with sweet potato fries.  The lunch special said $6.  When we received the bill it said $6.99.  Waitress said the sweet potatoes were an extra $.99 which she said was stated on the menu. It probably was but she should've told us because most people focus on the menu item and not added charges listed elsewhere.  The waitress had the manager remove the charge which was nice.  We didn't mind paying $6.99.  It was just the principle(sp).    So my bill comes to $6.50 with tax.  I give her $10.  She gives me $3 back.  What happened to the $.50?  I hate when they do that. So, of course I deduct the $.50 from the tip.    Wait, I have more.  My co-worker pays by credit card and sees a 4% service charge on her bill. Apparently because she paid by credit card?  Again, waitress said nothing.  Maybe it was in fine print on the menu? Who knows.

vDTHXx1xbOPKQ-isE_22sg.text: Fitzgerald's is the place to end up for many reasons. The first obvious reason is because they validate parking! All you have to do is buy a beer and boom your parking is paid for. A genius way to beat the high prices of parking around uptown. The parking lot you need to find is the Wake Forest deck, which is just down the street from it.   Another reason to stop here is if you are a Steelers fan (or Penn State). Game day here is the Steelers HQ. So weekends when there is college and pro football it's going to be a hopping place. Charlotte seems to have a LOT Of Steeler fans.   Throughout the week, Fitz has some really great deals including their burgers that go on special on Tuesday. Make it out for their pint night and play some trivia. They give away really awesome prizes!   Also make a pit stop before a Hornets game and buy cheaper food and drinks then when you walk into the stadium and prices skyrocket. Don't forget to enjoy their outdoor patio seating that's nice and perfect for watching the streets of Charlotte!

KsN9HUMQ_x2Zl8956BxC4g.text: Was uptown for an event at the Spectrum Center this past Monday night, (yes, Monday Night Raw baby!) so decided to drop in for a bite to eat before the event, instead of paying big arena prices for small arena portions.    Upon walking in the front door, was greeted by a friendly hostess and seated without a wait which was nice as it was already pretty busy and people continued to file in after we arrived.  Was cool to see that it was family friendly, as there was a nice mix of groups, pairs, adults and families with kids there that Monday evening.    Our server was very pleasant with a constant smile and was attentive without being overbearing, which is always a plus.  Never had to wait too long for a refill or wonder if she was on break (we have all experienced the "case of the disappearing server" at some point), as she came around multiple times to check on us and make sure all was good.  The manager also came by at one point, which is always a nice touch, especially when they pitch in to help clear a table or remove dishes, as it shows a team approach which is always cool to see.   Usually not a fan of Irish pubs as I find the food selection to be lacking for the most part, but must admit that Fitzgerald's completely changed the paradigm as their menu selection offered a wide array of sports bar favorites like nachos and wings to the rarely seen warm crab dip to old Irish pub standbys like Fish and Chips and Reuben sandwiches.   Ended up getting the crab dip, an order of nachos and the free pretzel bites that was offered with the Yelp check in coupon (thanks Yelp!).  Crab dip was very good, as were the pretzel bites, while the nachos were lacking on the chili as the chip to chili ratio was waaaaaay off, so a miss on that one.    Overall, the friendly service, abundance of tv's, cleanliness of the restaurant, solid value, and great location (parking is validated with purchase), this was definitely a solid 3 1/2 start experience, but great service always gets a round up from me, so 4 stars it is.  Will definitely give it another try as the menu has tons of choices to explore and I am looking forward to checking out the drinks next time I am there as well.  Fitzgerald's, congrats on making me rethink my viewpoint of Irish Pubs as if they are like you, then I definitely will be giving them more of a shot in the future!

1yZ0RFPkBTTEKUyWkYoF4A.text: This fun local bar in Charlotte is amazing. Its a great place to go to watch football, play trivia or karaoke. Its definitely a hidden gem in downtown.  Its a sports bar gone Irish. its a lot of fun. My husband and I love going to this bar in Charlotte before flying out of the airport.

pD2Kz8tnSO3KOcLJMYp5NQ.text: The hamburger was excellent, but the Rueben sandwich was terrible. The rye bread overpowered the corned beef, and there was very little meat to start with. No flavor in the coleslaw, ranch or thousand island dressing.  The atmosphere is 5+, but you can't eat the dark wood and beer signs. The hamburgers will get you through the night of drinking, but there are far better places to eat within walking distance. Eat first and then come here.  SATAN'S BREATH burger is HOT...HOT...HOT!  You will pay that night and a day later. It tastes good and that makes up for the cold fries.

kIwuAE7kFztzrAEiomrRNQ.text: I ordered the BBQ Chicken salad and it was delicious. The waitress was incredibly helpful. Our party had to leave earlier than expected and she was great about changing our orders to go. I will definitely be coming back to this pub in the future.

n5d6SyhSkEawTyvsHoAmbA.text: Where to start with such a great experience. The bar set up was dope really gave a home town feel to the restaurant. Started with the Fitzgerald's platter and hummus for an appetizer. The platter contains all my favorite things. Nice and hot too!!! Mozzarella cheese squares melted into long strips as you pulled it apart. The sweet and spicy wings were everything!!! Shout out to Paul Booker. Everyone should try the Mac and cheese plate. By far my favorite dish especially if you add salmon. Salmon was cooked to perfection. Shrimp Po boy was nice and crispy, full of flavor. Finished with a tiramisu cup life couldn't be sweeter!!! Thanks for the great service and experience Fitzgerald's. I can not wait to make it back to try more items.
