y7XPV3HZs_OojWOLYQp9_Q.text: Went for dinner. Got a barbecue burger, which was decent. Stayed after dinner to watch NBA games on TV over a few beers. They had lots of TVs showing different sports and a great playlist of 90's jams that night!

g4ccygd05RFKSJWBcL6Lvg.text: This place is just ok I won't go back food was not great and drink prices were outrageous  all I can say about my experience is it sucked!! Bring buckhead back!!!

FGqmW3ootjV0fHD0mvVeCQ.text: Is there a way to give negative stars?  We chose this place because it seemed like a nice quiet place to chill and talk.  At first, that's exactly what we got.  Our server was pleasant and quick with the drinks.  She left about 15 minutes after we sat down, however, and things turned awful.  We were harassed by 3 different homeless people for money.  Granted, it's not Fitzgerald's fault that homeless people come up to people sitting on their patio. However, they didn't take an active role in getting the homeless people to leave until one actually went into the bar.  They care about themselves not being bothered and not the customers sitting on the patio.  Around 1am we were told it was last call and asked by a bartender if we wanted another drink.  By 1:10 our tabs were all closed but we remained on the patio talking and finishing our last call drinks. As with all drinking, we took turns going into the bar to use the restroom.  At 1:30am we were told that we couldn't go in and out of the bar (even to use the restroom).  At 1:45 we were told by a bartender that the bar closes at 1:30 and the sign in the window and google (which both say the bar closes at 2am) haven't been right "for a long time." The entire time this was going on, the bartenders were sitting inside at the bar with a "friend" watching us. They were rude every time we used the restroom. They were rude about us being on the patio.  They were rude about picking up our glassware from the patio. At 1:55am they apparently got sick of waiting for us to leave and we watched as the bartenders ran up the street with the friend they were sitting at the bar with to make last call at another bar (which they told us they wanted to do earlier in the night).  The staff here do not care about this place or the perception their actions leave with the customers.  I wouldn't go back to this place if they were giving out $100 bills with every beer (which was only slightly above room temperature btw). There are far too many better options uptown to waste your time at a place that does not care about your business.

q-4pgQJQXRBCBxmgHQ8kfw.text: Im sitting here during the SUPER BOWL and this place has no satellite signal!  After asking around, I found that this is a regular occurrence.   Had I known I would NEVER cone to this place during a crucial sports event!  So pissed!!

y0wkL1W1ZLBcT4Ij1SEFAw.text: Seriously? I am honestly not sure which is worse. The food or the service! My food was horrible, I didn't eat it. But yet. Still paid for it! Waitress (Shannon) never checked on why my food was pushed to the end of the table! Now. I'm pissed and starving. Oh yea. The check was thrown at us. We weren't finished.

_COKeVxWS1l6F2zg5XRiXA.text: I went for all you can eat crab legs on Tuesday night. The food was amazing, service was friendly and quick, and the music was exceptional. Did I mentioned ALL YOU VAN EAT CRAB?! It doesn't get much better than that. The only downfall was aside from the decor, there is nothing pub-ish about the place...a very minor thing to overlooking for such a great experience.

X2Vk6WbgFD85oHVjyGTglA.text: Had lunch here.  The food was good I had the special for Friday, which was salmon, asparagus and mashed potatoes.  What was not so pleasant were the flies that kept circling around our food.  This made the experience very unpleasant having to keep fanning flies away.  We reported to the manager who didn't seemed concerned and said that she would close the door.  Not impressed.

VptIKf5d6UNQ8Nw8u6gxLA.text: Went to Fitzgeralds right after the lunch rush one day last week. gave this place a good review in the past but seems like it has gone downhill quite a bit. Bad service and mediocre food again at best. Seems the same every time i go.  I like the servers and bartenders but not worth the money when there are much better places to go downtown for lunch or dinner. may still go here for late night as they do really cheap drink specials some nights but thats about it

yupUcO9rGBDkFrRHgUqfAQ.text: Fun stop. Stopped by last weekend. Menu is pretty large. The burger i had was awesome and the fish and chips my friend had looked really good. Good drink specials too. Lots of tvs which was nice. The bartender was friendly and attentive. Overall i liked the place. will definitly be back sometime

RyMkDG8GMrwY5PzqXp6qIg.text: We came in at about 4:30 and ordered the Friday Special salmon in dill cream sauce and sweet potato crusted chicken. Seating was immediate and service was prompt and attentive, personable, yet not obtrusive. We drank draft Harps while our food was prepared. I absolutely LOVE draft Harp. There's an added taste of the Irish Sea: a salty, mineral-rich freshness which I don't taste in the bottled version.      Our food came quickly and was absolutely AMAZING ! We expected bar food, and instead received high-caliber cuisine unmatched by anything I have ever eaten elsewhere. My fiancee used to dine at the Tower Club, and this food matches the food prepared by a chef trained by Julia Child.      We had recently had similar entrees at a regional winery, and this food was so remarkably superior it was mind-boggling. The rather large piece of salmon was cooked perfectly: moist flakes of juicy flesh melted in my mouth. The dill sauce was a perfect complement, letting the flavor of the fish shine.The chunky mashed  potatoes were marvelous: a burst of garlic flavor, followed by spicy deliciousness with a creamy lingering finish... like a fine wine, there was a complete sensory trajectory. The asparagus, we both enjoyed, evidenced the chef's New Orleans training. My fiancee's chicken was extraordinary: the combination of sweet potato, red peppers, onions and mango was spiced superbly (cinnamon ? allspice ?); the chicken was cooked to perfection: tender and moist.       Our dinner was rounded out with draft Guinness and chocolate chip cookies soft and chewy and fresh from the oven, served with whipped cream and chocolate sauce which married perfectly with the stout    The meal was so extraordinary that I did something I have never done, namely, ask the waitress to convey to the chef that this was the finest restaurant meal that I have ever been served. The chef, Deacon, came to our table and we were able to compliment him and his skill and thank him personally.      The decor, ambiance and service were fine. The food was EXCELLENT ! ( Odd to us how haters rate this place too loud and too quiet and ignore the Irish food on the menu !)

yDJ3NaBErazrrOnF8tsbDQ.text: My friends and I dined in the restaurant on a Friday for lunch and it was horrible. This was our first time visiting the restaurant. We were there 45 mins & had to ask for our food, we never rec'd any refills on drinks. My fish was cold & It took 15 mins for me to get it back and it was just reheated. The microwave only takes 30 secs & the fish was just lukewarm. They could have at least given me a fresh one. I had asked for no mash potatoes & rec'd it anyway. The waitress told us that the special included honey glazed carrots, she was wrong. I found that out when I asked her why didn't I have carrots. She said that she forgot that it's asparagus today. Never asked me if I wanted or liked asparagus. She forgot the mac & cheese & when she brought it to the table she just laid it there and kept moving, no "I apologize" or an explanation. She never apologized or even looked at me when she brought the fish back to me either. The mac & cheese had some type of string in it. After poking & proding it, we still couldn't figure out what the object was floating in the mess of velvetta they call mac & cheese. She must have been having a bad day because it was written all over her face. The buffalo chicken sandwich had some shaved almonds on top of it. I assume it was supposed to be almond crusted, which wasn't on the menu. One of my friends had to go in the kitchen and get our ticket where she found the Mgr & the waitress chatting it up & laughing. She also hadh to stand over her while she closed out our ticket. She laid it down on the table and said "Oh, he gave you a 15% discount for the food and stuff". Really? He could have graced us with his presence. We were there an hour and 15 mins and there were only 3 tables ahead of us and they waited just as long as we did, some even longer. The Mgr never showed his face, unless it was the gentleman serving tables. I've heard the same complaints from other associates. They won't be in business long at this rate.

-gA57v_AdfmIUx4R5pVfvw.text: Wife and I had the Fish and Chips. We figured you can't go wrong in an Irish place. Well, we were wrong. Our first indication was seeing the regular, skinny fries on the plate. That's not "chips"in the sense of an Irish plate. The fish was terrible. I don't think anyone is this place has ever tasted it. The batter was so thick that is was brown and crispy on the outside but very doughy and chewy on the inside. So much so that with every bite I felt like I was eating raw fish. It was only the batter but man that was just a nasty texture. Didn't see anything on the menu to come back for...

hVsZUFWuim3ujjwX5MPt3A.text: The scene was a Friday night out with my friends. I had quite a bit to drink so I got up to use the restroom. As I approached down the hallway, the music of the bar began to be replaced by music of a different sort. At some point I realized that the music was actually coming from the bathroom, however I was not at all prepared for what I was about too walk into. The bathroom attendant. Quite possibly the coolest MF I have ever seen, on par with Samuel Jackson, greeted me with a slight head tilt and a faint smile. This man was wearing sunglasses inside and shredding a Dj turn table while pumping soap and handing towels out. I was at the urinal vibing to no diggity down to my soul in the most epic piss I've ever taken. When finished I saw a collection of every candy and gum that you could imagine along with cologne, condoms, lotion, and raw unadulterated swag.  It's for this reason alone that I give 5 starts, cause I really don't no much about the place.

akOWsqLIg2fYVw7J67b1vw.text: As much as I hate to say this.. I'm impressed. I'm a Browns fan (as you probably already know it's a ruff time) I'm going to put differences aside and I'm happy with the service. Our server Justin took great care of us! He was extremely attentive. Unfortunately, I can't give any critique about the food but alcohol and  service are on point. If you're looking for a place to hang out and grab a drink before a game or concert this is it.

pgKp3wnHCRLhI9MnOU8Dpg.text: Great bar. The staff goes out of their way to make you happy. I like sweet tea as a mixer, bit it's only available in the restaurant, and dumped when the kitchen closes. So they filled a couple of glasses to use for the rest of the night.

9v7efLiiImD3dczki_6wQQ.text: Ate there last night and had an awesome experience. Manager and staff were very attentive and reassuring that they were concerned the food tasted exactly as we expected. They went above and beyond. Highly recommend.

OI3nCO79qHk870LRfyQh4A.text: Great atmosphere for before Hornets games! Justin at the upper bar is very attentive too.

vbfubSd5F-_drpP6NHuSkg.text: Cool spot, came in on a Thursday night. Nice service and quick food. Loved the fish and chips and Sheppard's pie was great too. Wine was half price that night!! Good bang for your buck if you're looking for a chill atmosphere.

gHNGSNYf_k-mQx7zqidp8Q.text: Had dinner with a group of friends. Salmon came out like a dry piece of cardboard. When we asked to have something else we were told it would be a long wait by the manager because they were backed up in the kitchen. By reading the reviews you will see that many others had similar experiences.  The manager had no idea how to resolve or deal with the issue. Terrible attitude. Despite it all the waitress was sweet and we tipped her well. Save your money!  Overall we have found some excellent food and service in Charlotte. Sauceman's for Barbeque was outstanding and 5Church was a great meal with top notch service. Each deserves their own review.   As for  Fitzgerald's Irish Pub?  Awful food, even worse service, BIG MISTAKE!

LGET_URT2S7utQ8zqrX2QA.text: Stopped by for a late night round.  Great service.  Rachel makes the best Gimlet.  We will be back

h6ij6RomrR0X1r2I_4rJuQ.text: I really hate to rate Fitzgeralds this low - but I've gone a few times and have been disappointed with the food each time.   This last time I ordered chicken sliders and the mac & cheese.  I couldn't even eat the mac & cheese, but my waitress nicely removed it from my check.  The chicken sliders were very tough and hard to eat.  I do appreciate that they validate your parking for the Wake Forest garage, that has come in handy on weekends when they try to charge an arm & a leg at every parking garage.  The TV's and the sound are great for watching games!

BRXvYof3tIIWUQgE83JJsg.text: My husband and I really liked Fitzgerald's.  The service was great, the food was very tasty and the beer was cold and so good!  I had the Black & Blue sliders and they were delicious and my husband raved about the Steak Sandwich.   The restaurant has a very comfortable atmosphere.  Nice bar area with TVs and quite dining areas, too.  Great place for a night out with your honey or to meet up with a group of friends.   You also can't beat the location...central to Time Warner Arena, Blumenthal, and EpiCenter.   We are always looking for a place to eat whenever we are uptown for a sporting or theatrical event....looks like we have found our place!

a5DOv0lm8LdQwN7wuqMOUg.text: I've been here a few times over the years -- it's got a great location! Right in the heart of uptown a block away from The Epicenter. However, I had never truly experienced Fitzgerald's until I watched The Steelers game there this past Saturday. Man oh man! Black and yellow wall to wall! Steelers fans are one-of-a-kind and can be a bit much so hat's off to Fitz for being the official Steelers bar in Charlotte. I'm sure they catch a lot of crap but they handled it very well. The waitress was nice and the bar service was surprisingly quick considering the crowds. I'll be back for sure.. though I'll make sure to wear black and yellow if Pittsburgh is playing!  I hear they've got food too so next time I'll have to sample some.

V9BnPH_F6Ob9P82EaPQfbA.text: I probably come here too much for my own good, but I love the buffalo shrimp and mozzarella sticks.

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffal shrimp and garlic mashed potatoes :)
Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States

neEd8A9XTX4hJZ5P4YXQ_A.text: Meh. That is the perfect way to describe Fitzgeralds.  The place is not all together bad, but with a plethora of both restaurants and bars in Uptown; why waste your time with this place?  I've been for both drinks and dinner and both experiences were truly 'Meh.'   The food itself is not bad, its bar food-- the same stuff you get at any bar and its good enough-- but when the food takes forever and comes out cold-- kinda makes it hard to judge the quality.  The servers also seem not too inept with when it comes to being attentive or really serving at all.  I am sure there are good servers, but my experience was not so.   My friends came before me and ordered their food at the bar.  When we got a table they told the waiter that they were going to go tell the bar-- he said not too, that he would close out their tabs and transfer their orders to the table.  This was clearly not done as their orders sat at the bar for about 20 minutes before they were brought to the table.  This was only after asking repeatedly for their orders (since all of us were pretty much finished ordering).  He assured them again and again that the kitchen was working on it and they were just backed up.  Finally, the waiter brought the orders to the table and simply explained, 'yeah, they were sitting up at the bar.' No apologies.  Judging by the ice cold french fries-- the orders were sitting there for a while-- which seems a little unsanitary to me . . .   So in conclusion, Fitzgeralds is MEH.  Go somewhere else.  There are PLENTY of bars and restaurants in Uptown-- several serving up the same kinds of food and atmosphere as this place.  For that reason, save your time, your money and your taste buds from an evening at Fitzgeralds.

omDMFX1-m7VUFnDovljVmw.text: A large place to go and watch the Penn State Football Games.   The Penn State group in charlotte hosts their meetups and game watching at this bar, and that is what brought me into the bar.     The bar is styled after a Irish PUB, with 1 large bar, 1 small bar and lots of sectioned off seating.   Overall, its a nice place, clean and seem to draw in lots of people from around the uptown area.     Beer prices were normal with "going out uptown" prices.   Food was another story, I eat here a couple times and each time the food was pretty bland.  The mac and cheese was really bad.  The breaded Chicken fingers just tasted oily, same with the fish and chips.  Bottom line for me on this place: come to drink and hanging out, but go get some food else where.  TIP:  Bartenders at the Big bar validate parking for the parking garage.

c-YT63e8Wad6p4Xo1XubEA.text: I came here with Nicolette after we saw Cirque du Soleil for a late dinner, and to get our parking validated.  Since it was a Wednesday they were playing trivia, which probably starts somewhere around 9-9:30. We got there after the second round of 4, so we just played along, but not competitively, which was disappointing because they looked like they had some pretty great prizes.   On Wednesdays they have $3 drafts. They also have Woodchuck on draft, so I was pretty excited.   I ordered the chicken and cheese sliders, which have just chicken, bacon, and cheese. Doesn't that sound really good? Well it was. I ate 2 of them (they come with 4) and took the rest home for my husband to enjoy.   Nicolette ordered a massive burger with a lot of things on it, and a salad, that never came out. When she told our waitress, she immediately brought it out, and took it off the bill. It was a lot of food, but it was good for me because my sliders didn't come with a side, so I got to partake in Nicolette's fries. They were good, but could have been cooked longer, because they were kind of on the mushy side.   Overall, I had a lot of fun here, and if you can play trivia on a Wednesday, I would come out and have some fun!

3umK43jFkpD1zRFwq01aRA.text: Omg the food is delicious. I had fish and chips. Hubby had mushroom and gouda burger. Fabulous. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZQhTWzcfbr78Q5VQHduHmQ.text: Do not get their fried mozzarella. It's weird and it was cold and hard. The marinara sauce sucked, but the fries were ok. The service was also not good. Overall, this place is completely forgettable. I do not plan on returning.

DAuxs7flzcAcfNua5CdDEw.text: Food is OK, but kimberly and Steven are the best staff you will find in Charlotte! I'm serious can't find a better wait staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steven and kimberly with a guinness

taQJt5nxde_WcM4aJA8ucQ.text: As a sports bar Fitzgerald's certainly does it for me. Good wings and burgers, lots of big screens, and a decent beer selection. I'd happily go there any night to watch a game and get some grub.   As a late night bar, I'd go elsewhere though. The drinks are pricy and the scene and crowd isn't quite as exciting as other bars in the area.  But it does have a great location. It's in great proximity to the Epicentre and the rest of uptown, and the friendly staff and good bar food make it just above average. Go for some wings and to catch a game and you won't be disappointed.

L_sF8HkWuWCfoweZ7rLRYQ.text: Ordered via foodiecall for lunch this week. I had the chicken sliders which were pretty great, but standard. What sold me was the guinness tiramisu. I don't think I've ever had anything like it. Extraordinarily rich and decadent. Double layered. Thick, creamy mascarpone. Heaven on my tastebuds.  Can't wait to try the goatcheese burger!!

CoqrscLOzKYP4hMta3gzJw.text: This place looked like a fun place to watch a game, but the service was a bit lackluster. We were sat at a table outdoors, but it took about 15 minutes for a server to clear our table and greet us. Even after taking the dishes away, there were still several cheque folders on our table from the previous party. For an Irish pub, the Fish and Chips were very average. One member of our party had sediment at the bottom of her beer, but they comped that beer, so they earned some points there. A lot of places in Charlotte were closing early that night for "staff outings", so we landed here as our third or fourth choice. I'll try a different dish next time. The pork sliders looked very good, as did the burgers.

Db3gGvafpyGTUKfD_j7Mnw.text: I was never in here when it was Buckhead, but we stopped in Fitzgerald's over the summer for a beer before the Roger Waters concert.  A month or two later, I got a gift card as part of a silent auction package from the MS Society's Great Gatsby Gala.  What better day to use than when going to two events at the arena in one day?  We stopped in here for dinner between the Charlotte Checkers noon game and the Charlotte Bobcats 7:30 game.  I had the shepherd's pie which was probably the best version of this dish I have had.  The grilled asparagus as my side was very good too.  My friend got the Guinness battered fish and chips, and while he said that the fish (cod) was good, the fries and slaw left a little to be desired.  Our waitress was only okay; definitely not great service but not bad.  The place is huge so there is plenty of room for events before or after uptown events and it is really close to the arena.  If you drive, parking is free in the Wake Forest parking deck after 5pm. The only negative here is that they do not have a whole lot of beers on tap apart from Guinness and Miller Lite, but they at least have Fat Tire in bottles.  More local beer would make this a great place.

dT9FSvkjtRBGdKAbc5UrKQ.text: Now, I have to say I've only been here once for a Yelp event and I'm not sure if the chef that made our dinner is their house chef or a guy they brought with them... That being said, I'll comment more on the layout, service and overall vibe...  There is plenty of bar seating which likely makes this a cool place to come hang out... There's even a separate section with another bar up on risers and a dining area directly across from it... They do not have a way to cordon that off from the regular restaurant noise, though, so if you're trying to rent some space there, I would keep that in mind...   Their restrooms were pretty clean by Uptown bar standards and there were about 8 stalls, so I was definitely surprised and pleased with that... Normally, the lines are huge at a place like this, but that's got to help...   I'm going to tell you, the servers here were some of the best that I've encountered... Quick, frlendly and a lot of fun... They really seemed to want everyone to have a great experience and it showed...    They validate parking from the Wake Forest lot, so yay for that!  Who likes to pay for parking?  Not this lady...   I'll have to go back again to make sure the good food was really theirs, but I'll make sure to do an update when I get around to it!  Until then, this looks like a safe bet for some drinks and a nighttime hang...

Otp7rtoVFtLXLo6S9GWVuA.text: Walked in on a Monday night with 12 of my friends who work uptown and had amazing service from Rachel.  Being a bartender I couldn't of asked for better service.

F9GZFbSxe2ZwPj66G0RGMg.text: Bad service and worse food. The fried pickles are horrible...couldn't even eat past the first one. The only positive is that they validate the  $20 parking.

sslsZeiC4W9eP1Ds5AE_0g.text: Always go before Hornets games. Good beer selection and great bar food. Great place to go for Hornets or any Pittsburgh teams. Ask for Cyrena. She's the best!

J4xOV0ZPWRPqiKaEkBFB5g.text: It has been quite some time since I've hung out in the downtown Charlotte area - let alone try to visit the corner of 5th and College.  Even though Fitzgerald's replaced Buckhead's (a long time Charlotte staple since I've been here) I was taken aback at all the changes they made to the inside of the place.  They've classed it up a bit to make it much more than a bar... it's better suited for meals now.  It was funny being greeted by a hostess since I was just used to just going in and barring it up.  We were just planning on picking up tickets for an upcoming bar crawl, but we ended up eating dinner here.  The menu is quite large with some authentic Irish dishes.  I tried the Fish & Chips....  Usually I don't really expect much having been through my share of over-breaded, badly fried fish portions... but the breading here was nice and light with the fish perfectly cooked and moist.  The fries were nice a crispy too... way too many places present you with some cold, limp fries.  Lucky for us, Wednesday nights are Pint Nights!  all pints are $3 (with exception to Guinness... which made me somewhat sad).  It was still a good time.

bCOTagrGxKTsLaByNHJsoQ.text: I tried for first time before going to hornets game and it was a great decision, fun environment and contest before  game chances to win tickets also great food and drink special, plus validated parking which is a big plus specially in a game night...definitely will come back!

O4sf3Ylh3266f6O6O6uZAw.text: Smack dab in the center of the theatre district stands Fitzgeralds Pub, an Irish pub with a great atmosphere! The sports are always on and the beer runs cold. The staff here are so friendly and strive to accommodate the customer. The food is always hot, fresh and prepared to order. We've been coming here for 2 years now and have never missed a visit to Fitzgeralds! The General Mgr, Nick strives for perfection and it shows. Don't miss this place when you are in Charlotte! Oh and by the way, sitting on the patio is PERFECT!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fitzgerald's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Agh, a glass of wine, fried pickles on the patio!

3jqdJbDvZuUxZLZGKJf9Sw.text: Fitz's is best sports bar in Charlotte. It's a fun atmosphere when Penn State or Pittsburgh Steelers score a touchdown. Great service, good bar type food and burgers. Daily food and drink specials and Parking is free with a validation.

caviMvZNRO8_vSsYnXrUfA.text: Wave those Terrible Towels!  Being a Pittsburgh transplant, I was looking for a bar to watch the Steeler's game and read great reviews about Fitzgerald's. My nephew (also from Pgh) was visiting Charlotte, so we went to Fitzgerald's to watch the Patriots-Steelers game Sunday Oct 23.  From the moment we walked into the place, we felt "at home".  We sat at the back bar and were treated like family by Dina and Zane.  They totally hooked us up ;)  From the abundance of Steelers fans and flat screens, to the beer selection and great food, we felt welcome. They even played cool music whenever there was a commercial break in the game.  Garage parking is free and conveniently located right next door.  Will be back for sure!

RvEyrxUPud-NDZKbTfaJ6Q.text: Long story short, been there for 30 minutes and finally we received two waters. There was 4 of us. We order two apps and three bloody Marys. 30 minutes later, no bloody Mary. Server finally came and told us they ran out of bloody mix. We decided to cancel our order and leave.

vY9NwzZTuFQKVeLloCKV2w.text: Came here on a suggestion from our uber driver, we wanted to watch the game and get some food. Starting at 9pm they start their late night menu which consisted of chicken tenders, chicken wings, or fries.   Service wasn't great, we had to ask a few different times to ensure our drinks and part of our food order was on our way out. The chicken tenders were to die for, the chicken wings were disappointing for a sports bar.   Plenty of TVs and good atmosphere but the rest kind of fell short.

H24EG9vv_Say5o-wPabHsw.text: This place was such a surprise. I wasn't expecting much considering the previous reviews, however came here on a whim and was pleasantly surprised. My bf and I sat at the bar in the back and the bartender was super sweet. She poured us great drinks and provided great service. I got the fried pickles (free upon checking in with a $5 purchase) and bf ordered fried mozzarella and side of fries. Soooooooo good. Seriously some of the best fried pickles I've ever had and they were lightly breaded so it wasn't so greasy! The fries tasted like Arby's curly fries minus the curly part. The fried mozzarella was some of the best I've ever had (& I love mozz sticks). These were in the shape of a triangle and had so much cheese in them. I would come back just for these. The atmosphere was great too, we were there right before a Charlotte Hornets game and it was crowded but not too packed. We had a great time and plan to come back!

ndlSD8H3GNAKKyG3NvIYBg.text: Ate at the bar by myself while traveling.  Had a $3 draught special that night that the bartender told me about so I ordered. Black and Tan.  Failed to tell me that Guiness was the one exception when I said "sounds great" and ordered the B &T.   She also had no clue how to pour a B&T even though the spoon was right there next to the tap and other bartenders were using it.  Regardless my $9 drink tab was $19.50 when it arrived, the bartender headed for the hills so I just paid it rather than wait any longer.  As for the food, the Reuben was soggy but good.  Really liked the corned beef.  The blue cheese dressing was the consistency of milk with some tiny bits of something that I assume was flavorless blue cheese.  Too many other choices down there.

8Zigkv4ZWZZtaHXtjNRIBQ.text: Could not have been more disappointed Sunday (yesterday) the bartender was to busy looking at her phone to even wait on us. Then when we finally got seated outside the waitress seated us right next to a street person that was sitting out there (??) he had puke all over his shirt...so I moved us to a different table. We ordered two slightly dirty martinis that tasted like she poured about an ounce of olive juice in them....really awful. I received crappy service from the same bartender last month so that is it for me at this place. To many other places that want my business.

p0fz3OkeffTYV1t7LmK4CA.text: Stopped by on a Saturday night to grab a few drinks and it was packed. We finally managed to get a few beers and then later went back to get a rum and coke and a Long Island ice tea. Not sure if the bar tenders are actually trained in how to make drinks as the Long Island was far from what a True Long Island is and the rum and coke was more coke then rum. While we know it was busy - our service was horrible as the two female bar tenders were more concerned with chatting and assisting the younger crowd that was there. Won't be back.

fDp-gSoXCd6FP9VcbKzsBg.text: God, they just try so hard. They have great specials, a huge space and it seems to be really easy to win a happy hour for your friends but this place is just always empty and when you have a giant empty bar it's hard to have fun.  CLT might just have too many irish bars for their to be room for this place but I wish them success because they look like they're doing everything they can to bring in more people.

bZgN2zkb7mkol8CLvhOw-Q.text: Horrible. The bartenders ignored us for over 15 minutes while they helped several others that came up to the bar after us. Perhaps they need to get a male bartender who is is willing to wait on females.
